source_citation: GHDx
data_choice_notes: Using 52.1% of urban population eating Atta (whole grain flour) for percent of population eating wheat flour, because it is the only estimate we extracted that is larger than the GFDx estimate of 43% of the population eating industrially produced flour. The GFDx number comes from the same 2016 survey, and they estimate that 60% of households grow wheat and locally mill it. Discarded numbers (also from the same survey) include 47.3% overall population and 45.5% rural population eating Atta, and 8.8% overall, 16.5% urban, and 7.4% rural population eating Maida (refined) flour.
